title: Barcelona 'view PSV wonderkid Donyell Malen as the ideal striker to compete with Luis Suarez'
text:
Barcelona are reportedly ready to launch a January bid for PSV wonderkid Donyell Malen as they attempt to provide competition for Luis Suarez.

According to reports in Spanish news paper Sport, Barca boss Ernesto Valverde has sent scouts to watch the 20-year-old in action in each of his games this season.

Barca's talent spotters have been blown away with the Holland international's stunning start to the season, which has yielded 17 goals in just 21 games for club and country.

Barcelona have reportedly sent scouts to watch Donyell Malen at all of his games this season

The striker has already scored 17 goals in 21 games for club and country so far this season

Barca believe Malen is the perfect man to provide competition for Luis Suarez

The Spanish club are not short of attacking options following the summer signing of Antoine Griezmann and emergence of 16-year-old Ansu Fati.

However, the inconsistent form of Luis Suarez has been a concern and the club hope the potential signing of Malen will provide competition and a long term replacement for the Uruguayan.

Donyell Malen stats: 2019/20 Age: 21 Apps: 21 Goals: 17 Assists: 6

Malen's rise has been a steep one; after breaking into PSV's first team last season, the striker was handed the club's No 9 shirt following the sale of Luuk de Jong to Sevilla.

Malen has since formed a front three with fellow Holland prodigy Steven Bergwijn and Bruma and proceeded to put Eredivisie defences to the sword.

His performances have been even more remarkable given he was in Arsenal's academy until 2017, with the Gunners selling him to PSV for just £500,000.

Arsenal have since been linked with a move for their former player, along with Liverpool, meaning Barcelona could have competition for his signature.
description: Barcelona are reportedly ready to launch a January bid for PSV wonderkid Donyell Malen as they attempt to provide competition for Luis Suarez and bolster their star studded frontline.
